column3: ACK a16c6d23cadb517f1e728c719a316768ae7b7fe8\n\nI'm really tempted to add formatters for MiB and whatnot as a new format specifier in `tinyformat.h`, as we have this logic all over the place.
@eklitzke Formatters for MiB, etc sounds nice!

> I'm really tempted to add formatters for MiB and whatnot as a new format specifier in tinyformat.h, as we have this logic all over the place.\n\nI'd prefer not to make such changes to tinyformat.h locally. Unless you manage to upstream it (https://github.com/c42f/tinyformat), an utility function would be preferable. Although this is arguably so simple I'm not sure how much is gained by that.
Wouldn't replacing 1024 with 1024.0 here (and in the other case) have the same effect, but avoid the cast?
